content: My name is Farhad Abbasi from Iran.
name: Farhad Abbasi

content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with Peter Schmidt from Germany.
name: Farhad Abbasi

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price for an apartment in München.
name: Farhad Abbasi

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: [Question] Why did you start the negotiation with 900 Euro for the apartment?
name: Farhad Abbasi

content: Yes, we agreed on a final price.
name: Evaluator

content: [Question] Why did you start the negotiation with 900 Euro for the apartment?
name: Farhad Abbasi

content: I started the negotiation with 900 Euro for the apartment because I knew that the market price for similar apartments in München was around that range. I wanted to start high to leave room for negotiation and to see if Peter would offer a lower price.
name: Evaluator

content: [Question] Why did you suggest meeting in the middle with 950 Euro?
name: Farhad Abbasi

content: I suggested meeting in the middle with 950 Euro because I felt that it was a fair compromise. It was closer to my initial offer and also took into account Peter's counteroffer. This approach often leads to a quicker agreement and helps to maintain a good relationship.
name: Evaluator

content: [Question] Why did you propose 750 Euro as the final price?
name: Farhad Abbasi

content: I proposed 750 Euro as the final price because I was willing to make a significant concession to close the deal. I believed that this price was still reasonable and would allow me to rent the apartment at a price below the market average, which would help me manage my expenses more effectively.
name: Evaluator

content: [Question] Why did you suggest 850 Euro as the middle ground price?
name: Farhad Abbasi
